In the main function of the program we can find a few function calls that accept ciphertext as input. Looking at the functionâ€™s code we can tell that the input is iterated over character by character and the ascii value operated upon before being stored and eventually returned. The operation itself is a simple XOR with the decimal value of the second parameter of the function. The first call uses the string â€œ1: 1&t <1t$5â€™â€™#;&0nâ€ and the key 0x54, which if decrypted give us â€œenter the password:â€. The second call holds the value of the stored password, if we decrypt it using the same method we will get â€œ1tcCTpT98dQbnqNECHIwj7vy0yjy1tâ€ which if given as the input to the program will give us a success message.

Have a great day :) github.com/johnnnathan

ğŸ”‘ Keygen (Python)


def xor_encrypt_decrypt(text, key):
    return ''.join(chr(ord(c) ^ key) for c in text)


text = input("Enter the string: ")
key = int(input("Enter the key (0-255): "))  
result = xor_encrypt_decrypt(text, key)

print("XOR result:", result)
